did.unittitle: Museum Association of New York Records
did.abstract: This collection documents the day-to-day activities of the Museum Association of New York and its predecessor organizations.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection contains administrative records, including finances, annual meeting records, council and board minutes; conference files; publications; workshop and program materials; advocacy work; subject files; grants. Given the merger and name change history within the organization, there are records of the Museum Association of New York but also of others, including the Upstate History Alliance, the Regional Council of Historical Societies, and the Federation of Historical Services.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. Please contact an archivist for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Erika Sanger of the Museum Association of New York donated all items in this collection to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collecitons and Archives in October 2023.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: First organized in 1960 as the New York State Association of Museums (NYSAM) and chartered by the New York State Education Department in 1962, as it exists today, the Museum Association of New York (MANY) is the product of a 2013-2014 merger with the Upstate History Alliance (UHA). The UHA began its life as a member of the Field Service Alliance (FSA), a nationwide organization, and operated under the name of the Regional Council of Historical Societies (RCHS) for much of its corporate life. Prior to the merger, UHA changed its name to MuseumWise. That name was discarded as part of the merger process.

Today, the Museum Association of New York is the only statewide museum service organization with more than 700 member museums, historical societies, zoos, botanical gardens, and aquariums. MANY works with museums and museum professionals to develop and share best practices through advocacy, training, and networking opportunities.
